info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 2 at 5:34PM EDT until July 2 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Western Wake county.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. This includes along Interstate 40 between Durham and Garner.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - This storm is capable of producing an inch or more of rain over a very short period of time. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Lake Wheeler, William B Umstead State Park, New Hill, Carpenter, and Research Triangle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. If driving, use caution and slow down to avoid hydroplaning.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING
